measures.description: Total quantity of Cerazette (0703021Q0BB), as a proportion of total quantity of desogestrel (0703021Q0).
measures.why_it_matters: This is the NHS Business Service Authority's top cost-saver from   generic switching. Cerazette and desogestrel are both exactly  the same drug, the same molecule, but Cerazette is an expensive  branded package, and desogestrel is a cheap generic package.
measures.name: Cerazette vs. Desogestrel
measures.title: Prescribing of branded Cerazette (BNF code 0703021Q0BB) compared with prescribing of all desogestrel (BNF code 0703021Q0)

measures.description: Total quantity of Keppra (0408010A0BB), as a proportion of total quantity of levetiracetam (0408010A0).
measures.why_it_matters: This is one of the NHS Business Service Authority's top cost-savers from  generic switching. Keppra is an expensive branded form of the chemical  levetiracetam. The MHRA's guidance is that it is usually unnecessary  to maintain patients on a specific manufacturer's levetiracetam product  unless there are specific concerns such as patient anxiety, or risk of  confusion or dosing errors.
measures.name: Keppra vs. levetiracetam
measures.title: Prescribing of branded Keppra (BNF code 0408010A0BB) compared with prescribing of all levetiracetam (BNF code 0408010A0)
